content.question: Which of the following statements about geothermal energy is accurate?

choices.label: While geothermal energy can heat buildings directly, it is not used to generate electricity.
The location of geothermal energy sources ranges from short distances below ground to miles below the surface.
Steam from underground sources must be condensed before it can be used aboveground.
In some parts of the world, geothermal sources are used to power steam locomotives.

content.answer: The location of geothermal energy sources ranges from short distances below ground to miles below the surface.
